page.title: 19THE RIVER CAMEL
page.content: In the River Camel on the 1st July 1985 they surveyed an area of the Camel 70.80 metres long. THE RESULTS. SALMON FRY,27,SIZE RANGE 2.6_5.1 CM SALMON PARR,70,SIZE RANGE 9.4_13.3 CM TROUT FRY,28,SIZE RANGE 4.4_6.6 TROUT PARR,76,SIZE RANGE 9.6_27.4 The other species found were EEL,BROOK LAMPREY and some BULLHEADS.There are more fish in the River Camel now than there were in 1977. Camelford is here because this was the lowest place where the river could be crossed easily.People used to travel on this side of Cornwall because there are many deep valleys in the south. They used to beach their boats and carry their cargoes over land to the south coast.They changed their mules in Camelford.The river gave water-power for at least6 mills.
